stem: Given question: What is something only humans can do? and answer: drive cars, explain why in
no_more_50_words: Humans, unlike animals, cannot drive cars.
50_to_100_words: Humans are capable of driving cars because we have the cognitive ability to understand the complexities of operating a vehicle, including interpreting traffic laws, recognizing road signs, and making split-second decisions to ensure the safety of ourselves and others. Additionally, we have the physical ability to control the car, including the dexterity to operate the pedals and steering wheel, as well as the ability to look in different directions, such as over our shoulder when changing lanes. Furthermore, human possess emotional intelligence, which includes ability to perceive, control and evaluate emotions, which will help us in the real-time decision making during the driving. While there has been significant advancements in autonomous driving technology, currently, no machines are able to replicate the cognitive and emotional intelligence that humans possess when it comes to driving a car.
